intro: Bebbia juncea, commonly known as the slender bebbia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Bebbia juncea has slender, upright stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of native plant communities and a subject of ecological study.
